alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Aroostook County through 715 PM EDT... At 633 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles east of Limestone to near Mars Hill to 7 miles north of Dudley Township. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Fairfield, Mars Hill, Easton, Bridgewater, Dudley Township, Littleton, Monticello, Blaine, Westfield, Ludlow, Number Nine Mountain and Saint Croix. This includes US Highway 1 between Littleton and Mars Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
